A novel serum biomarker is being evaluated for early detection of pancreatic cancer. The concentration of this substance has been found to be elevated in patients with pancreatic adenocarcinoma. Test results in 200 volunteers ("healthy") and 190 patients with biopsy-proven pancreatic cancer ("diseased") are given in the figure below. The investigators determined the sensitivity and specificity of this indicator for pancreatic cancer using a cutoff of 200 IU/dL (indicated by the solid vertical. If they had instead used a lower cutoff as indicated by the dashed vertical line, which of the following would most likely be seen?

A 35-year-old homeless man presented with a 1-month history of fever, cough, and weight loss. Both sputum smears turned out to be negative, but the chest x-ray ordered was suggestive of tuberculosis. Which is the next best line of management?

options.label: D
options.text: Wait until TB culture results to start ATT

Identify the correct statements about lower extent of the following structures: Subarachnoid space-Lower border of S2 Filum terminale-Coccyx Spinal cords in infants-Upper border of L3 Adult spinal cord-Lower border of L1

An 18-month-old girl is brought to the OPD by her parents due to a rash and blisters throughout the body that started this morning. Yesterday, the child had a fever that responded well to ibuprofen. This morning, the parents noted erythema and peeling skin around her mouth, axillae, and inguinal areas. Slight focal pressure to the back results in sloughing of the top layer of skin with underlying erythema. The face appears edematous, with perioral crusting. No mucosal lesions are seen. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis in this patient?

A research group conducted a placebo-controlled clinical trial to assess whether a new drug to treat acute migraine with or without aura in adults is more effective than standard therapy. During the data analysis phase, the researchers decide to set alpha at 0.01 rather than 0.05. Which of the following is the most likely result of this change?

options.label: A
options.text: Any significant findings will be reported with greater confidence

options.label: B
options.text: There will be a higher probability of a type I error

options.label: C
options.text: There will be a higher probability of finding statistically significant results

options.label: D
options.text: The study will have more statistical power

questions.correct_answer: A. Any significant findings will be reported with greater confidence
questions.explanation: Ans. A) Any significant findings will be reported with greater confidence

questions.text: A young male came to the hospital with a clean-cut wound without any bleeding. The patient received a full course of tetanus vaccination 10 years ago. What is the best management for this patient?

options.label: A
options.text: Human tetanus immunoglobulin and full course of vaccine

options.label: A
options.text: Caters to a population of 2.5 lakh

options.label: B
options.text: Referral centre for 4-5 U-primary health centers

options.label: C
options.text: Other hospitals may be present in the area

options.label: D
options.text: Should have a 50-bed facility in metro cities

questions.correct_answer: D. Should have a 50-bed facility in metro cities

A 54-year-old man with hypertension and hyperlipidemia who came to the emergency department with chest pain wants to know if he is having a heart attack. Test A is newly available for diagnosing myocardial infarction (MI). In a recent study, the results of test A (compared to a gold standard diagnosis of MI) were as follows. The patient has a positive result on test A. Assuming his pre-test probability is equivalent to the prevalence of MI in the study, what is the probability that the patient has an MI?
A patient of blunt chest trauma has been intubated and started on mechanical ventilation. Which of the following is not correct about the initial setting?

options.label: D
options.text: Tidal volume - 12 ml/kg of actual BW

questions.correct_answer: D. Tidal volume - 12 ml/kg of actual BW
questions.explanation: Ans. D) Tidal volume – 12 ml/kg of actual BW

questions.text: Identify the correct statements: Most common cause for hospital admission after day care surgery is post-operative pain Commonly used frequency of tetanic stimulation in neuromuscular monitoring is 2Hz. Add 0.5 ml Heparin to the syringe before taking blood for ABG Dobutamine stress echocardiography is the most accurate non-invasive investigation to predict risks of perioperative cardiac complications

A researcher wants to know whether there is an association of CRP values with the risk of myocardial infarction/stroke. The study group was divided into quintiles and the following table is formed based on the study results. Which of the following statements is true regarding the relationship between CRP and the risk of myocardial infarction/stroke? CRP - C-reactive protein

options.label: A
options.text: CRP has no association with risk of Mi/stroke

options.label: B
options.text: Increase in CRP leads to increased risk of MI/stroke

options.label: C
options.text: Increase in CRP decreases the risk of Ml/stroke

options.label: D
options.text: In quintile 1, there is no risk of MI/stroke

questions.correct_answer: B. Increase in CRP leads to increased risk of MI/stroke
questions.explanation: Ans. B) Increase in CRP leads to increased risk of MI/Stroke

questions.correct_answer: A. Cardbord box with blue marking
questions.explanation: Ans. A) Cardbord box with blue marking

questions.text: All of the following are true except:

options.label: A
options.text: Codex Alimentarius is the principal organ of the FAO/WHO food standards program

options.label: B
options.text: Vanaspati is fortified with 2500 IU of vitamin A and 175 IU of vitamin D

options.label: C
options.text: Methylene blue reduction test is the best test for efficacy of pasteurisation

options.label: D
options.text: Sudden onset of hypersecretory glaucoma, diarrhea, and cardiac failure is seen due to sanguinarine toxicity

questions.correct_answer: C. Methylene blue reduction test is the best test for efficacy of pasteurisation
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Methylene blue reduction test is the best test for efficacy of pasteurisation

A 24-month-old child weighing 11 kg was brought to the pediatric OPD. He had a respiratory rate of 38/min. On examination, chest indrawing was observed. What is the next step of management?

options.label: B
options.text: Urgent referral to the tertiary care centre immediately

options.label: C
options.text: Administer IV antibiotics and ask the patient to be brought after 24 hours

questions.correct_answer: A. Oral amoxicillin for five days
questions.explanation: Ans. A) Oral amoxicillin for five days

questions.text: What is the dosage of vitamin A given for a 2-year-old baby with keratomalacia?

options.label: A
options.text: 2,00,000 IU immediately, followed by same dose after 24 hours

options.label: B
options.text: 1,00,000 IU immediately, followed by the same dose after 1 week

options.label: C
options.text: 1,00,000 IU immediately, followed by the same dose after 24 hours and after a week

options.label: D
options.text: 2,00,000 IU immediately, followed by the same dose 24 hours later and after 2 weeks

questions.correct_answer: D. 2,00,000 IU immediately, followed by the same dose 24 hours later and after 2 weeks

Identify the type of study described in the scenario:

A study was conducted on two different samples for comparing variation between DBP and Vitamin D. The mean diastolic blood pressure is 110 with standard deviation 11 and the mean vitamin D level is 18 with standard deviation 3. Which of the following statement is true regarding the coefficient of variation (CV)?

options.label: A
options.text: CV of DBP is more than Vitamin D

options.label: B
options.text: CV of Vitamin D is more than DBP

options.label: C
options.text: Both DBP and Vitamin D have equal variability

options.label: D
options.text: It cannot be ascertained from information provided

questions.correct_answer: B. CV of Vitamin D is more than DBP
questions.explanation: Ans. B) CV of Vitamin D is more than DBP
